greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer solutions to a^2 + 2*b^2 + 2*c^2 + 4*d^2 = n.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Olivia X. M. Yao, Ernest X. W. Xia, Combinatorial proofs of five formulas of Liouville, Discrete Math. 318 (2014), 1--9. MR3141622.
formula: Yao and Xia give an explicit formula for a(n) due to Liouville.
G.f.: theta_3(q)*theta_3(q^2)^2*theta_3(q^4), where theta_3() is the Jacobi theta function. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 03 2018
maple: for u from -ul to ul do
for v from -vl to vl do
for w from -wl to wl do
for x from -xl to xl do
if sx <= M then hit[sx]:=hit[sx]+1; fi;
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 14 2014
